name: AlmaSevilla - Hotel Palacio de Villapanes

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a delightful break at the palacia and in seville. The hotel is gorgeous- really tastefully decorated while retaining a lot of original features. The service was attentive but not overbearing- we mentioned that we had escaped the kids for an anniversary treat and when we arrived home that night cava and fruit awaited us- a much appreciated touch.
reviews.title: Highly recommend-Stunning hotel which manages to combine style with attentive service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was spacious with a great shower and the most comfortable bed- it was like sleeping in a large marshmallow. Loved the touch of the free mini bar too....
reviews.title: Elegant modern hotel with a small boutique attitude

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautiful courtyard for a recline and a drink- the drinks and food menu appeared wide- although a gin and tonic was 10 euros versus 5 up the street in santa cruz bars. Cant really comment on the food as we didnt avail of breakfast, preferring to go for a jog round the city and stop for a smoothie at the cathedral. We didnt use the spa although it looked great (but only opens 3pm plus- mind you we probably would have used it if it had been open in the morning).
reviews.title: Interesting hotel, but possibly too chic?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are probably only two minor down sides if I had to be really picky
reviews.title: Magnificent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - one is getting home via the windy streets after an evening out- thank the lord for google maps on the iphone in the abscence of bread or pebbles a la hansel and gretel! Its about a ten minute walk to the main areas- cathedral, santa cruz etc. However once we got the hang of it (night three) it was fine. Plus the hotel offers a welcome respite from a busy city so the location also has its pluses.
reviews.title: Deservedly Number 1 in Seville

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011
reviews.text: When we arrived, Cristina offered to book us for an evening of flamenco. She also offered to find us a tour for Ronda. She helped us organize ourselves. Lorena was also kind and helped us settle in by giving us passwords for the Internet and bringing me a pillow with more body. Certainly beyond the call of duty.
reviews.title: Friendly staff and modern rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Our room was modern and spacious. There was an Apple computer in the room. I did not like the colors of the bedroom and bathroom-brown and black. However, it was comfortable and the bathroom was big. The shower had a big showerhead and even had additional showerheads for a great shower!
reviews.title: An Oasis

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: It was a 10 minute walk to the Cathedral. However, we never did start our day by walking. Instead, my friend with a knee problem insisted on getting a cab. It only cost about 6 Euro to the Cathedral area. We did walk home in the afternoon after shopping. Elcorte Ingles and lots of other stores are nearby.
reviews.title: Luxurious Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a bus stop at nearby Ponce de Leon but we did not have a chance to explore the bus routes.
reviews.title: Super cosy hotel, but confusing dining experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Buffet breakfast was not as varied as other buffet breakfasts that we had during our trip. Altogether, though, we were satisfied with the hotel. I would not mind staying there again.
reviews.title: beautiful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A real palace, with an imposing entrance facing another palace. Gorgeous patio. Very friendly attentive service. The room was large with a modern bathroom: great walk-in shower, bathroom combination on gorgeous wood/granite. Very well designed.
reviews.title: Excellent experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All around terrific restful stop in a very special high class place .five stars for us .
reviews.title: Perfect, beautiful and wonderful service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a Grandedeluxe room, which looked down onto a beautiful, peaceful courtyard. The bed was extremely comfortable, and the bedroom was just the right size for a weekend stay.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel but skip the overpriced breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom had a lovely deep double ended, free-standing bath, which was perfect for sharing! The separate shower area (also big enough for 2!) had a choice of powerful body-jets down the wall (6 of), a big daisy-head shower above and a power shower that could be detached from its hook (for those particular about the cleanliness of nooks and cranies). Also, considerately, the toilet (and bidet) were behind a separate door in the bathroom, though no lock, to partner's consternation. I have no idea what he thought I was going to do to him whilst he was in there.
reviews.title: Elegant and quiet hotel, lovely breakfast, 5*+ star staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The atmosphere of the hotel (bearing in mind it is low season) was peaceful, serene even. The hotel has managed to combine elegance and mod-cons in an extremely stylish manner and the attention to every detail is evident.
reviews.title: A Fabulous Luxurious Boutique Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011
reviews.text: We enjoyed our 4 night stay in a standard room. The hotel is nice, probably more of a good 4 star than a 5. This might sound picky but a lot of the good reviews on this site are based on superior rooms, not standard rooms. A few negatives, room was small, dark with a strange layout. Tv plonked in front of the window, electrical sockets wobbly, room service lying in hallway all day, having to ask staff to refill mini bar, soaps etc...not really 5 star treatment. However, on the plus side, comfy bed, great location, friendly staff, fantastic large shower. I would recommend it but the standard rooms are very, um standard given the cost of our stay.
reviews.title: Nice, but not quite worth the reviews

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in Room 223 which is classed as Grand deluxe. The room is large, clean and modern with a separate bathroom area and off that a shower room and toilet. The bath has no area to put soap etc. so everything ends up in the bath! Between the bedroom and the bath area there is a desk but that is right next to the bath with no door separating it which is rather strange. The bedroom overlooks a pretty courtyard and is nice and quiet except that they play 'muzac' all day which is annoying if you have the window open. The beds are very comfortable and the bedding good quality. There was no specific area to put suitcases so they ended up on the chair or on the desk which we felt would damage them. The first night the air-con was set at 19 degrees which was far too hot for us and we had to have the window wide open overnight. After asking for it to be dealt with that evening we had to wait until the next day after we made it very clear that it had to be dealt with urgently and they set it at 16 which was better. It would appear that the controls in the room are not capable of being adjusted by the guest which is crazy for a 5* hotel. We had to ask twice for the free mini bar to be restocked and also for the tv to be reset to allow us to view all 50 channels to include English ones rather than the 10 we encountered on arrival which were all foreign. There is no info in the room about the area or nearby restaurants and we were continually in the very small reception asking questions or getting things sorted out in the room. The staff are friendly and helpful but don't wear name badges so you don't know their names when referring to them. One male member of the reception staff with glasses was particularly helpful.
reviews.title: Beautiful building and very clean but not 5* due to annoying omissions

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The area the hotel is situated is not in the main tourist area which was not a problem for us and we walked to the Cathedral, river etc. with ease. Seville is a delightful town with lots of alley ways to get lost in and some beautiful buildings to see. We felt completely safe all the time and were not worried about walking around at night. We visited the Casa de Pilatos just because it was so close to our hotel on our last morning and it was well worth the visit. There were long queues to visit the Cathedral even in February. You can get discounted entrance fees to many of the sights if you are over 65 and can prove it with a passport etc. We did not have our passports on us on the first day but did have our London Council Freedom Passes which were accepted.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: The hotel recommended the Becerrita restaurant to us and many other guests for dinner. We were not very impressed with it as we had to send back the fish as it was uncooked in the middle and some of the bread rolls were very hard. It has very small rooms and with just one or two other tables you can easily hear their conversations. Their prices were very high for the quality of food. We didn't use the hotel's restaurant which is in the basement. We never saw anyone in it as you can see the tables from the street as you pass by.
reviews.title: Simply wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011
reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel but would advise to check the room carefully to ensure that everything is to your satisfaction especially the heating. It is such a pity that this was not done for us which was a disappointment and not what is expected for a 5* hotel. We paid £581 for the 3 nights which is very expensive. With a little more care and attention to detail this hotel would deserve to be highly recommended.
reviews.title: Perfect. Deserves to be number 1

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: This being my first visit to Seville, I decided to take TripAdvisor contributors' recommendations and selected this property for my 3 nights stay. Location wise, it was not in the center of the town and quite far from the main shopping and tourist attractions. The roads in Seville are generally small, winding and confusing. Even the maps given are sometimes misleading so beware! I would not recommend this property for someone who wants to be at the "center of it all". For that, the Gran Melia Colon seems much better located.
reviews.title: Modern, unique boutique hotel but needs some improvements

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is a beautifully renovated building with an inner courtyard and with the typical Andulasian architecture. The rooms are quite spacious and we had a deluxe suite which had a very large bathroom equivalent to the size of the bedroom itself(Room 111)! There was however, no multi-purpose desk in the room, which made working with a laptop very difficult. Style over substance. The bed was not King sized as I had asked for - instead, it was two twin beds pushed together! The mattress was too soft for good lumbar / back support and the pillows were way too soft causing a bad neckache after sleeping.
reviews.title: Perfect place to stay in Sevilla

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Housekeeping was generally good and prompt and the room (still relatively new) was well maintained and clean.
reviews.title: Only good for the business traveller

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was disappointing though. Not much fresh fruit and the cereals were minimal.
reviews.title: Excellent !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While the reception and front office staff were all friendly and helpful, they seemed to all lack experience in running a hotel. I had to ship / courier back some documents but they did not seem to know how to help me! Quite disappointing.
reviews.title: Good but not excellent.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: this is a very nice hotel about 10-15 minutes walk down twisting streets to the center of night life in seville. located off a quiet street, one walks up to a beautiful courtyard. greeted with a cool drink we were shown to our dark, but modern well appointed room with the best bath in any hotel we have ever stayed in. the inner courtyard is lovely with lots of comfortable spots to lounge and read in the afternoon. the staff was great. this is a real find.
reviews.title: fantastic value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is beautiful. The pictures, as great as they are, do not do this hotel justice. The rooms are also lovely, the bathroom spectacular and the beds as comfortable as can be. The service at the reception desk was also excellent, loved the top floor pool area, and also the outside patio, as well as the many interior spaces to sit and relax.
reviews.title: LOVED this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Our only complaint is about the food service. We loved the breakfast, pricey, but lovely service. (We also eventually found some lovely nearby cafes for a coffee con leche and croisssant or breakfast sandwich.). We had dinner one night in the hotel, mediocre but exhausted after all day tour outside the city. Our major complaint was about service in the patio area. They don't seem to have figured this out, everyone had to wait LONG times for server to appear to order a cocktail, often had to go inside to find someone. They need to figure this out -- and other fabulous aspects of this hotel make it still THE place to stay. (I had also read other reviews about how "far" it is from things, but easy walk to all major attractions, and also nice that it is on the edge of the old town so can easily get out to easier to navigate streets when need a change.) We would absolutely stay there again!
reviews.title: Good choice for enjoying Seville

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a stylish, well situated hotel within easy walk of the principal attractions of Seville.
reviews.title: quiet luxury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I particularly liked:
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel with lovely staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: As others have mentioned, this hotel is located on a quiet side street. The check-in process was pleasant; the staff seem to go out of their way to helpful. From the outside the hotel isn't particularly impressive but inside it's beautiful.
reviews.title: Incredible

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our suite was #223 and overlooked one of the courtyards.. There is a hallway that connects a bedroom and a bath area. In the hallway there is a comfortable chair for reading, also in the bedroom. There is also a good sized desk in the suite. The room is beautifully done; some of the original architectural features from the home survive in the room. The floor is hardwood looking. The bathroom is amazing; a huge soaking tub, a shower stall with multiple jets and a rain nozzle, two bowl sinks. The hotel has two courtyards that are beautiful, a somewhat bare rooftop terrace with a small plunge pool. There is free wi-fi. There’s a mini-bar in the room who’s contents are free (soft drinks, water, juice, beer). There is an elevator.
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The drinks and food at the hotel seem to be reasonably priced and you can ask them to make exceptions and they don’t seem to go into shock (for breakfast I just wanted a small fruit plate instead of the buffet; no problem and it came with a small price). The staff is great and go out of their way to try and be helpful.
reviews.title: Fabulous Hotel!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Now the cons: there is no coffee maker in the room. There is no clock in the suite, anywhere. Storage space for clothes is severely limited; I think the area for hanging clothes is maybe a 14 inches wide. There are some shelves to put items on but only two drawers. There are no luggage racks to put luggage on (there’s room for one). Attached to the bed are two high tech reading lights which twist around to illuminate your book, which are great but be careful that you don’t hit your head on them (my spouse did).
reviews.title: Palace by Name Palace by Nature

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My understanding is that most of the rooms here are different from each other. Our friends’ rooms included a small sitting area and was configured much differently than ours but was still very nice.
reviews.title: Beatiful but not perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just back from a fantastic break in Seville with my partner. The hotel was fantastic. Fabulous room with really comfortable bed. The shower was amazing and the room very spacious. We loved the design too. Some lovely perks like the free mini bar which was re-stocked every day and regular turn down service. The reception staff were brilliant and booked our flamenco show, river cruise and Arab Baths tickets, all of which we would recommend. We did not eat at the hotel so cannot comment on that. About 10/15 mins walks from the Santa Cruz district but we really enjoyed the walk. Would definitely recommend this hotel and would love to go back.
reviews.title: Fantastic holiday in Seville

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Beautiful building with a lot of attention to design in furnishings, rooms, etc,..Very helpful front desk staff. The room was dark, the bathroom had a ridiculously small vanity making it difficult to shave or apply make up, . No phone in living area making it necessary to sit on bed to make a call.Noisy room with only windows overlooking the lobby.
reviews.title: Nice design hotel, lacking comfort.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: Will appeal to those who love design but don't care about comfort and convenience. on the other hand, it will not appeal to those who like comfort and conveneience.
reviews.title: My favourite hotel in Spain

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a fabulous hotel. Although it was a little bit farther out from the catedral (and by a little farther I mean only a 10 minute walk) than some of the other hotels I looked at, iIt was definitely worth it. The rooms were gorgeous, the staff was by far the friendliest, and most helpful of any of the hotels that I stayed at in Spain. My room had juliette balconies which meant that I could fully open the doors at night which overlooked the courtyard. It was fabulous!!!
reviews.title: A beautiful city retreat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were delighted with our stay at Palacio de Villapanes, it was our first trip to Seville and it is a great choice.
reviews.title: The Star Treatment

description: AlmaSevilla-Hotel Palacio de Villapanés is located by the historic neighbourhood of Santa Cruz, and a short walk from the bustling city centre. It is a jewel that shines brilliantly, taking us back to the Mudejar period, uniquely important to the city’s history. It was originally built in the early years of the 18th century by Don Manuel López Pintado, the first Marquis of Torreblanca del Aljarafe. It has recently been refurbished, and today art, design and culture, as well as a decor tending towards the minimalist, enable guests to discover and enjoy a different Seville.
